Name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Building – Harbinger Comet Shard
Description:
Fragments of the Harbinger Comet broke off at regular intervals during its approach and subsequently survived reentry to impact in countless locations, including several deep within populated cities. Initially thought to be random, these strike locations are now seen as part of a deliberate pattern. Composed of alien materials, these structures are resistant to conventional weapons and contain within them slumbering forces awaiting the call to feast upon the world.

—description from the publisher

Name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Building – Shadow Sun Industries Building
Description:
The Shadow Sun Syndicate’s corporate efforts touch on countless high-tech industries as well as providing secret support to just as many criminal or quasi-legal operations, and its facilities can be found across the globe. Some of these are geared toward facilitating military intervention, garrisoning interceptors and sun fighters as well as servicing shinobi and zors in the field by restocking volatile mutagenic agents and calibrating nanite control systems.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer Underworlds: Nightvault – Thundrik's Profiteers
Description:
Bjorgen Thundrik and his crew of skyfarers were not the first among the Kharadron Overlords to search for Shadespire. The whispered rumours of the Katophranes’ treasures had reached many sky-ports, but those expeditions that were sent either returned empty-handed or did not return at all. With a hardy crew and a magnificent skyvessel at his command, Thundrik set out to achieve what all others had failed to do.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer Underworlds: Nightvault – Ylthari's Guardians
Description:
With the advent of the necroquake, the life magic of Alarielle has been able to seep through cracks in reality back into Shadespire. Some of the Sylvaneth trapped there have stirred once more, with Ylthari and her Guardians being the first to awaken. Imbued with bountiful vigour and wrath, they seek the lost soulpods of their fallen kin.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bloodborne: The Board Game – Forsaken Cainhurst Castle
Description:
Forsaken Cainhurst Castle is a big box expansion that opens the doors to this fortress, represented by 12 new tiles, where you will be able to experience not just 1, but 2 full campaigns, plus a side-mission Chapter, all populated by 20 miniatures, including 5 types of Enemies and 2 Bosses!

—description from the publisher

Name: Piecepack Klondike
Description: Piecepack Klondike is a version of the solitaire card game that plays somewhat the same, but with a smaller deck of tiles.

Name: Cultistorm: The Investigator Expansion Pack
Description:
‘Reinforcements have arrived’ in the form of the Investigator Add-on pack, which includes 4 brand new detectives for use in the game.

Stephen Dawson, the master of Cults, spends his free time wandering the forests of Arkham alongside his loyal Pointer companion. Together they sniff out any signs of dark rituals!

Special Agent Tony Russo is an expert in finding missing people. His skills allow him to manipulate cultist trophies. He also gets a special introduction in the Short Story Collection.

Jacob Burns was a priest before he encountered the forces of evil. After seeing these powers at work he decided to join the detectives in their fight against the cultists. His character receives 6 extra cards, which are best used in the ‘Dark Rituals’ expansion.

Serena Higgins’ story also holds a special place in our Short Story Collection. She is the dimension wanderer of the team and also receives 6 extra cards, which are best utilised in the ‘Otherworlds’ expansion.

The new detectives come with miniatures, character boards, and unique detective decks utilising their skills.

—description from the publisher

Name: History to Heaven
Description:
Create a new human's history!
You become leaders of human beings, and lead them to the perfect paradise with 52 great men.

Each players picks out 1 card from their hands, and the biggest number card wins.
However all cards have different special abilities, and these make complex strategy.

Repeat 10 times that putting 1 card from hands.
In the end, a player with the largest sum of paradise points will win.

Players are forced to choose which cards to put out in a very limited choice, whether to offer additional as support, or not to take out.

It is a game that you can play freely many times with 50% luck, 50% strategy.

---STORY---
- The purpose of humankind is to be happy -
- The place where is satisfied all, we will call "Heaven" -

This is the universe of the parallel world.
On the Earth there, a new history of mankind was about to begin.
Great persons who lead people are born in different century, and struggle to make a new history over and over, to bring humankind into the heaven.

The era of the game starts from the 1st century, and it will end in the 10th century.
The players become leaders of humankind, to develop humankind with great persons, and to guide people to the heaven.
Eventually the player who get the highest total of heaven point will win.

---Game flow---

     Deal cards
     Place 1 card face down
     Face up card or pass +1
     Influence"Struggle"
     Support (You can add Power. But supporter's Influence does not activate and does not remain in History)
     Winner determined
     Influence "Victory","Defeat"
     One winner remains in History
     To the next century


(At the end of the 10th century, player who have the highest total of Heaven win in this game)

—description from the designer

Name: Don't Be SHY!
Description:
This is a communication card game to talk about their own life and philosophy.
Each player send a card in hands that written question about life.
Answer question each other, repeat this 10 times.
At the end of this game, all players will understand each other about thier lives.
This game provides the opportunity to respect the other people's live.

â–¼Concept
Talk myself frankly, and understand each other.
I want to provide these opportunities. So I produced this game.

This game includes elements of self-development. But I hope you enjoy easily.
At first time, parhaps you will feel you don't want to speak about yourself deeply. But I hope you will find pleasure that to speak your self and to know other people and share lifes.

â–¼Overview
Let's talk about yourself! And let's get to know friends better!
A person who talks a lot wins.
This is a card game to help you communicate and mutual understanding.

Question Cards Ex.

     What was the best experience in your life?
     When was the most excited moment in your life?
     What was the most accomplishment thing in your life?
     What is the ideal work for you?
     What ideal person do you want to become in your future?
     What is the part that you most love about yourself?
     What is the worst regrettable thing in your life?
     When did you consider suicide?
     What was the worst crisis that might have ruined your life?


—description from the designer

Players take turns answering questions. If a player answers a question, he gains one point. If he does not answer a question, another player may answer an gain the point. The player with the most points wins the game.

—user summary

Name: I Love You
Description:
Five killers kill each other. Who survives to the end?

Each player chooses one character board and uses it, and fighting with all players.
Who survived to the end will win.
Squares on the board means Life and Action at the same time.
Player can move by reducing Life as much as you want. Then, activate the effect of the stopped mass.

6 Effects of Masses(Attack, Attack and Move, Hide, Get Resource, Get Card, Recovery).
6 Skills(Attack×2, Defense1/2, Avoid, Revenge, Break Resource, Get Card).
5 Effects of Cards(6 Lives, 7 Resources, Avoid, Move Again, No Avoid and Hide).

Darkest burning sun rises today too.
At the end of the world, which killer can survive to the end.
It is...

—description from the designer

Name: Boxwalk
Description:
Expand your color, and Hide your color!
 You can play in 5 minutes, "Position Expansion & Hide Color", 
 2 to 4 person match gameâ™ª

At first, dealt COLOR-CARD is your color.
Place dealt BOX-CARDS and spread your color. At the end, all players vote on other player's color by VOTE-CARDS. 
Then his points will be reduced. Finally the player having the biggest points will win.

—description from the designer

Name: Yeti or Not!
Description:
Become a true scholar of crypto-count-ology!

Gnomes, mermaids, dragons, the Loch Ness monster, and more... Yeti has invited all of his friends over for a game of hide and seek - And he wants you to join in on the fun.

But beware... It's going to take a keen eye and a quick mind to keep up with this crowd of notoriously unfindable friends...

Lay out the 8 double-sided Find Boards in a 3 x 3 grid around the scoring board and then place the 9 numbered Yetis onto the scoring board.

Ready to put your seeking skills to the test? - Flip over one of the Unfindables cards and - Quick! - Everyone must search fast to figure out how many times that Unfindable is repeated throughout all 8 of the Find Boards.

Once you find an answer, move fast to snatch up the matching Yeti. Whoever grabs the correct Yeti first wins a point. Whoever has the most points after all the cards have been played wins the game!

Easy to learn yet challenging for the whole family - Yeti or Not, you're in for an intense adventure.

—description from the publisher

Name: Changing Challenges
Description:
A chess-like game with gravity - you move your pieces in order to achieve victory, but you must also make sure not to tip the board, because that makes you lose.

—user summary

Name: Gaining Gravity
Description:
Perhaps your opponent is able to knock you out – but he might be more interested in capturing preys. Don’t let him discover that he can knock you out.

The main strategy in Gaining Gravity is to balance between caution (don’t be knocked home by your opponents game piece) and greed (capture as much prey as possible).

—description from the publisher

Name: Dangerous Dip
Description:
Dangerous Dip has a strategic basis like backgammon. Strategically this game involves either getting through the field quickly or collecting as much prey as possible.

—description from the publisher

Name: Gravity Chess
Description:
A gravity game where the pieces move according to chess rules. Each player has one king (weight 6), three queens (weight 4), four rooks (weight 3), four bishops (weight 2), and four pawns (weight 1).
You win by a) taking so many opponent pieces that the board cannot be placed level, c) placing your king on the center line without your opponent being able to take it, or c) taking your opponent's king.

—user summary

Name: Nothing Personal (Revised Edition): Family Business
Description: The Family Business Expansion includes the gangster, influence, and casino cards from the original expansions (Young Turks, Associates, and Power & Influence). These cards have been updated to better fit the Revised Edition, but are still backwards compatible with the original edition.

Name: Gravity Gammon
Description:
A backgammon-like gravity game. The board has a few shortcuts.
You can win either by getting your pieces home first, or by your opponent tilting the board.

—user summary

Name: Bushido Duels
Description:
A dueling card/dice game where samurai warriors try to best their opponent. All players have a hand of nine cards, 6 identical and three special techniques unique to their fighter. The players duke it out using a clever rock-paper-scissors based system until one fighter is knocked out.

—description from the designer

Name: Treasonable Doubt
Description:
In Treasonable Doubt, players take the role of factions fighting by night to gain control of the remote nation of Intrepigo.

On their turn, players send agents, each of whom have been trained to various levels, to key locations on the island. Once all agents have been dispatched, they are revealed, and the player with the highest value of agents on each location gets the first choice of the available actions at that location.

Actions include gaining and trading resources like documents, guns and luxuries, completing missions, training agents, and gaining intel in one of three research areas (Training, Combat and Politics.)

After the 6th round, the coup is won by the player who has gained the most Influence over the island - be that through missions, political influence, or completion of their secret agenda.

—description from the publisher

Name: Don't Sweat It!
Description:
Don't Sweat It! is the party game of mismatched moves! Go head-to-head in hilarious challenges featuring over one hundred classic dance moves and pop culture poses!

—description from the publisher

Name: Sushi Holic
Description:
Sushi Holic is a memory game of sushi-making theme. It consists of 40 pieces of tiles: 12 pieces of 3 pieces of tiles for sushi, 12 pieces of wasabi tiles, 12 pieces of rice tiles and 4 pieces of special tiles, green tea tiles.
To play the game, first place all the 40 tiles face down on the table. The starting player chooses one tile and turns it over. If he/she succeeds in turning the rice-wasabi-material tile in order, one sushi is completed and the three tiles are taken by the player. If one of them fails, the turn is immediately passed on to the next player. If you turn over a green tea tile, take that tile and turn over another tile again. The obtained green tea tile can be used to inspect another tile at any time during the player's turn. When one player completes the number of sushi set according to the number of people, one round ends, and the person who earned the specified goal round score first wins the game.
Sushi holic comes in two editions: 'Maguro edition' and 'Tamago edition' which have different material tiles but same rule. The two editions can be combined to play with up to 8 players.

—description from the publisher

Name: As Majesty
Description: The game As Majesty is a chess-like game played between two contenders, moving pieces over an hexagonal field where the objective is to invade the territory of the other player.

Name: The Island of El Dorado: Legend Edition
Description:
The Island of El Dorado: Legend Edition is a Kickstarter-exclusive box that includes all content ever released for The Island of El Dorado: the base game, Thieves expansion, new Revenge expansion, new organizer trays used during gameplay, Kickstarter exclusives and all stretch goals unlocked in this and previous campaigns.

–description from publisher

Name: Unmatched: Bruce Lee
Description:
In battle, there are no equals.

Unmatched is a highly asymmetrical miniature fighting game for two or four players. Each hero is represented by a unique deck designed to evoke their style and legend. Tactical movement and no-luck combat resolution create a unique play experience that rewards expertise, but just when you've mastered one set, new heroes arrive to provide all new match-ups.

Bruce Lee is a single-hero expansion to be used with any existing Unmatched full set. It includes a hero miniature, a health dial, and 31 cards.

—description from the publisher
Families: Misc: Watch It Played How To Videos

Name: Race to the Moon
Description:
Race to the Moon is a two-player competitive deck-building game set in the historic Space Race. The players take the roles of the USA and the USSR as they try to be the first nation to land a man on the moon. Players begin with similar but asymmetric decks, unlocking new cards that can be acquired as they advance in science and technology.

—description from the designer

Name: Table Battles: C3i #32 Scenarios
Description: Two new scenarios for Table Battles: Battle of Gaines Mill (one of the Seven Days Battles from the American Civil War) and Battle of the Bouvines (a decisive victory for France's Philip Augustus against the Holy Roman Empire in the early thirteenth century).  Includes 9 (two-sided) cards representing the units for each battle.

Name: Waste Knights: Second Edition – Scavenger
Description:
A new player knight, the Scavenger.

- Mr. Mall Miniature
- Knight Sheet
- 4 Upgrade Cards

Name: Waste Knights: Second Edition – Paths of Blood
Description:
The "Paths of Blood" expansion comes with:

- 1 completely new adventure: Rise of the Red Lord featuring approx. 150 dedicated entries.
- 7 special cards
- 5 Boss Tokens

The Kickstarter edition comes with the exclusive 51mm Red Lord Miniature.

Name: Waste Knights: Second Edition – Call of the Waste
Description:
The Call of the Waste mini-expansion comes with:


     10 unique Landmark cards
     10 cardboard Landmark tokens.

Name: Wall
Description:
Year 1961. The construction of the Berlin Wall begins with simple barbed wire fences. From one day to the next, the inhabitants of the German Democratic Republic are locked up in their own country.
 This makes many more want to flee, not only because of the siren songs of the West, but also because of the possible separation from their family, the disagreement with the regime,... an endless number of reasons with a common denominator: "they want to be free people".

A semi-operational game in which one of the players will lead the Stasi while the others will have to try to get some of their citizens to escape to West Berlin.

Name: The Big Book of Madness: The Vth Element
Description:
The Big Book of Madness: the Vth Element is an expansion for The Big Book of Madness base game.  Your goal remains the same: you must close the book before succumbing to madness. But will you be able to handle the new Dark Matter and Phobias?

The Dark Matter and the Phobias are two different modules that can be played together or separately.

The Dark Matter module adds the Vth Element and the following game elements: the Dark Book, Dark Curses, Dark Monsters and new Magicians.

Phobia Cards are Madness Cards with a permanent constraint.

—description from the publisher

Name: Agricola: Times they are a-changing
Description: Thus far the only card to be released in Agricola's H-Deck is H00: Times they are a-changing, a Minor Improvement card, which obliges players to remove their previously played Occupation cards.

Name: Stora Racerspelet
Description:
This auto racing game is one of several sports-themed games published by Klee and/or Spika in Sportmagazin compilations and then sold separately in Sweden. It may be from the 60s or early 70s.

Although the game is basically a normal roll-and-move game with event spaces, there are a few things setting it apart. First, instead of racing from start to goal, you go around a circuit five times. Second, two dice are used to move. Third, there is player elimination, but players can only be eliminated in pairs, meaning the effect on the outcome is quite different depending on whether the player count is 2 (game ends), 3 (remaining player wins) or 4 (remaining players continue and may or may not also be eliminated).

—user summary

Name: Lady Majonna
Description:
In Lady Majonna, a.k.a. ãƒ¬ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ»ãƒžã‚¸ãƒ§ãƒ³ãƒŠ, the players are witches at the "Royal Magical Academy" and the "Lady Majonna Cup", an annual race, is about to begin. The players use their cats and magical items to advance and hope to win the race. After several races, the player with the fewest negative points wins.

Players move by using poker-style hands: two pairs, three of a kind, three card straight flush, and four card straight flush. Players draw cards from a draw deck or in order from other players' discard piles. The players can use their cat to reserve cards for their next turn.

The winner of a race earns no points. The other players lose 1 point for each card left in hand and 2 points for each magic item left in hand.

Name: Der Tunnel: Escape from East Berlin
Description:
In Der Tunnel: Escape from East Berlin, a.k.a. æ±ãƒ™ãƒ«ãƒªãƒ³ã‹ã‚‰ã®è„±å‡º, one player takes on the roll of the leader of a group that hopes to defect to the West and the other is an investigator with the secret police. The defector player wins if they are able to open the escape tunnel to West Berlin, and the investigator wins if they are able to arrest a certain number of the asylum seekers.

On their turn, the defector assigns a certain number of their members to different tasks such as tunnel construction, fund raising, or simply spending time in the city. These members are assigned face down.

The investigator places cards down on the different assignments hoping to arrest the defectors; the faces of the cards match the different members of the defectors.

The different members of the defectors have specialties, such as tunnel-digging. Arrested members can be released on bail. The game continues until one of the sides meets their victory condition.

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Hand of the King Expansion
Description:
Kickstarter Exclusive Hand of the King Promo set

For "A Song of Ice and Fire Miniatures Tabletop Game"
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: How to Train Your Dragon: The Hidden World
Description:
How to Train Your Dragon: The Hidden World is a racing game for 2-4 players, based on Dreamworks 3th movie 'How to Train Your Dragon - The hidden world".

Goal of the game is to bring your own 3 characters to the finish first. You do so by drawing an action card on your turn. According to the action on the card you are then moving your characters, have to pause, ore move the dragon ring to ban other characters.

—user summary

The players go on an adventurous journey with the popular dragon riders Hiccup, Astrid, Fishlegs and Snotlout and try to draw their three figures in front of the other players to the finish. With the help of the beautifully designed number cards, players are making fast progress on the board. But beware: A bad dragon has the game heroes in his sights and tries to cast a spell over them! With a dragon ring the game pieces are captured and prevented from progressing. But with luck and some tactical skill, players can escape the dragon's spell and reach the target first.

—description from the publisher
Families: Movies: How to Train Your Dragon

Name: Fate of Fantos: The Iridium Wars
Description:
Throughout the eons, hordes of aliens and beasts from across the galaxy have descended upon the planet of Fantos in search of Iridium, the life force of all existence. As the hordes multiplied, conflict became commonplace, splintering the population into rival citadels. Eventually, war, greed, and the depletion of resources pushed Fantos to the brink of destruction, and in response to the planet's cry for help, Zodraz, the Cosmic Warden, intervened, sentencing the planet to a great cull to be survived by only a single worthy citadel.

Fate of Fantos: The Iridium Wars is a tableau-building card game with competitive and co-operative elements for 3-6 players, each assuming the role of a unique citadel of Fantos. Each are responsible for hiring acolytes to manage their affairs, with the ultimate goal of obtaining the most Iridium, and therefore the most favorable position when Zodraz finally arrives.

Citadels must manage their Iridium harvesting strategically, however, as it further contributes to the pollution of Fantos, revealing new trials along the way. Zodraz also unleashes plagues, summons cosmic creatures, and forces dissent between the citadels as the game progresses. Citadels must choose whether to resolve them together as a planet, or watch as rival citadels struggle to survive.

Name: Blondie-spelet
Description:
Ordinary roll-and-move game along a 100-space track, with event spaces such as "lose a turn" and "move forward X spaces". There is one space involving player choice, as a risky shortcut can optionally be attempted. The illustrations and descriptions chronicle events in a normal day for Blondie and Dagwood in a largely non-chronological fashion.

There's no publication date, but the logo used is from the 40s or 50s.

—user summary

Name: Emil i Lönneberga
Description:
A card game with a bluffing element based on one of author Astrid Lindgren's characters, published in the late 70s or early 80s.

Each player is trying to get rid of an initial hand containing mischief cards and good behaviour cards among others. Mischief cards can be played face up at the risk of gaining penalty points, or face down. If a player plays a father card, each other player must show the top card of their play pile if it's face down, risking even more penalty points if it's a mischief card.

—user summary

Note: Not to be confused with another Alga game with the same name and the same theme, Emil i LÃ¶nneberga.

Name: Sheets & Giggles Game
Description:
The Sheets & Giggles Game is a party game for adults with 4 rounds of hilarious, inappropriate, action-packed word play and innuendos considered offensive by most. You and your team will describe outrageous words and phrases, act them out, give one-word hints, then act them out again under a sheet. Score points by quickly getting your team to guess cards correctly while using the rule for each round.

FOREPLAY: SETTING UP
Step 1:
Split into teams– ideally 2 teams of 3 to 6 people.

Step 2:
The game should consist of about 45 cards total. To start, everyone gets 10 random cards and places a few of their favorites face down in a pile until there are enough.

HINT: Don’t share your cards with anyone, even the other players on your team!

HINT: The number of olives indicates the dirtiness of the card. The more olives, the dirtier it is.

Step 3:
Combine and shuffle all chosen cards from both teams into one pile & put them face down on a table, in a bowl, or in the box. All cards, regardless of who chose them, will be used by both teams.

Step 4:
Choose your least favorite people to keep score and time.

DOING IT: HOW TO PLAY
Each Sheet Head gets a 60 second turn to try to get their team to guess as many cards as possible using the rule for that round. Once a card is drawn, it must either be guessed correctly or returned to the pile when time expires. Teams take turns guessing cards – every member of a team should take their turn as Sheet Head before any teammate repeats.

Each of the 4 rounds end after all cards are guessed correctly. To start the next round, reshuffle all the cards and continue in the order you left off.

HINT: If your memory sucks, read the cards aloud after the first round.

THE POSITIONS
Round 1: Sheet Talking
Sheet Heads get their team to guess the card without saying any part of the words on the card.

Do’s: Speaking – Like texting, but with your mouth.

Don’ts: Act, gesture, rhyme, spell, abbreviate, say any part of a word on the card.

Round 2: Be Charade, Be Very Charade!
Sheet Heads get their team to guess the card by acting. This should sound familiar.

Do’s: Act, Gesture, Point.

Don’ts: Talk, make noises, spell with your hands.

Round 3: The S-Word
Players get their team to guess the card by saying only ONE word. This is more challenging than you Sheet Heads think.

Do’s: Say ONE word, use different Inflections, use accents.

Don’ts: Say another word, mouth other words, gestures, rhyming, Use a word or part of a word on the card, suck.

Round 4: Sheet Show
The Sheet Head puts a sheet over their head and acts out the clues.

Do’s: Act out the card under the sheet, you Dumb Sheet.

Don’ts: Talk, come out from under the sheet, make noises.

THE CLIMAX: HOW TO WIN
The team with the most correctly guessed cards after all 4 rounds wins. We don’t care how you keep score, but tally scoring or collecting correctly guessed cards does the job.

—description from the publisher

Name: Clash of Rage: Heroes Expansion Pack
Description:
It is time for the Heroes to get back into the heat of the action! Recruit Heroes to accompany your troops into the heart of battle, taking advantage of their powers. Teleport yourself behind enemy lines for surprise attacks, or produce magical shields for damage control. The Heroes will ramp up the RAGE!

Contains 8 Hero miniatures and Hero cards to expand Clash of Rage.

Content:

1 Hekna, The Assassin Hero miniature and card
1 Neggesh, The Fearsome Hero miniature and card
1 Razaro, The Exalted Hero miniature and card
1 Agastos, The Corrupt Hero miniature and card
1 Berihn, The Protector Hero miniature and card
1 Eldric, The Commander Hero miniature and card
1 Shamia, The Tenebrous Hero miniature and card
1 Voltane, The Bellicose Hero miniature and card
40 Plastic Crystal Tokens
8 Plastic Rage Skulls

Name: Clash of Rage: The Mechanical Cohort
Description:
Composed entirely of rebellious proud women, the Mechanical Cohort tirelessly pillages their neighbors. Thanks to their mobile fortress and their knowledge of the desert, they remain elusive to all the armies who have hoped to overpower them. For them, the rumor of the fall of the Elves is a sign that a new world will soon be born!

Additional clan. This is an expansion, it requires the base game “Clash of Rage” to be used. Allows you to play skirmish games up to 5 players, or to swap with an existing clan for campaign mode and solo mode.

Name: Clash of Rage: The Heirs of Kkran
Description:
After being forced to mine crystal deposits as slaves to the Elves, the heirs of Emperor Kkran have just broken their shackles. These people, powerful when united, are now determined to regain their greatness from a time in which Kkran, the hero of ancient legends, reigned and ruled with an iron fist.

Additional clan. This is an expansion, it requires the base game Clash of Rage to be used. Allows you to play skirmish games up to 5 players, or to swap with an existing clan for campaign mode and solo mode.

Name: Four's Not Enough: Fairy Party!
Description:
Fairies love parties.
However, they never host it themselves. It's a hassle for them to send out invitations and arrange a hall for it. This is where you come in!
You set up the party for them and in return receive "Sparkles".
But be careful! Don't start the party until all the fairies have gathered. If you try to start the party prematurely, you'll put the fairies in a bad mood!

Gameplay:

The player is helping fairies and in return receiving Sparkles. The player will play fairies (cards from value 0-3) to party halls face down. If you think you've gathered 5 or more fairies, give the order and start the party.
If a player has gathered 15 or more chips (sparkles), the game ends. At that point, the player with the most chips is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Ate the Game
Description:
Ate the Game is a party game that combines word-guessing and role-playing. A cluegiver draws a series of cards with words ending with the suffix -ate and tries to get their team to guess as many as they can in one minute, while also playing a role as defined by a Mandate card.

Set up:
Divide into teams of at least two people. Separately shuffle the ATE deck (cards with words that end in -ate) and the MANDATE deck (cards that dictate how the cluegiver must act while giving clues).

Gameplay:
The Mandator draws an ATE card and one MANDATE card. When they are ready to begin, the opposing team starts a 60-second timer.

The Mandator tries to get their team to guess as many ATE cards as possible while performing the MANDATE card.

At the end of a turn, the playing team has one chance to guess the current MANDATE card. If an ATE card remains unguessed when time is up, the opposing team has one chance to steal the card with a correct guess.

Correctly guessed ATE and MANDATE cards are one point each. A stolen ATE card is two points. A skipped ATE card (The Mandator is only allowed to skip one ATE card per turn) is minus two points.

The game ends when each player on a team has performed as the Mandator twice. The team with the highest score wins or play a tie-breaker round.

Name: TTMC Tu te mets combien: la Carte Goodie
Description:
Just shuffle the card with the others during set up.

Card found in Plato Magazine 116

Name: Bloodborne: The Board Game – Upper Cathedral Ward
Description:
It is known that the Healing Church has its secrets, but in this all new full Campaign, Hunters will be dispatched to discover exactly what those secrets are. Sending the players high above Yharnam to the towers of the Upper Cathedral Ward, this campaign features a new story, unique enemies, and new mechanics in the form of Frenzy - the horrors of the mind being forced to comprehend things it was never meant to comprehend, all leading up to a final confrontation against one of the most iconic enemies of Bloodborne: Ebrietas, Daughter of the Cosmos.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Enneagame
Description:
The Enneagame™ is a card game based on the 9 fundamental personality types of the Enneagram. Wield the unique abilities of each type to avoid Identity Crisis cards and be the last playing standing!

You avert the identity crisis by playing a self-discovery card from your hand. Some of the self-discovery cards have special abilities as well, related to the specific personality types, and others are just general self-discovery cards.

Play as each personality type.

—description from the designer

Name: ラストダンスは私に (Save the Last Dance for Me)
Description:
Summary:

The king has organized a royal ball, at the end of which the princess is going to finally choose a husband. Players begin with 4 cards each, playing 1 card on the table each round. The cards in the deck represent different guests attending the ball, each with their own unique ability. Use these to peek at, trade, or steal cards from other players. The two players holding the "Princess" and "Prince Edward" cards during the final round are declared the winners.

This game can be played by anywhere from 4 to 8 people, but some cards are used only if you have enough players. This means bigger groups will result in new abilities, forcing players to change up their strategy.


Gameplay:

1. Deal 4 cards to each player.
2. The player holding the "Princess" card must flip her over so everyone can see.
3. All players choose 1 card from their hand and place it face down on the table.
4. The player holding the "Princess" flips over their chosen card and carries out its ability.
5. Continue clockwise around the table, each player activating their card's ability.
6. Once all players are finished, the round ends.
7. Repeat steps 3-6 two more times.
8. When all players have 1 card remaining, everyone places their cards face-up on the table. The 2 players holding the "Princess" and "Prince Edward" cards during the final round are declared the winners.

Will you aim for the "Princess" knowing everyone at the table can see exactly where she is? She is sure to draw the attention of other players, moving back and forth just like she would in a dance hall.

Or will you instead try your luck and search for "Prince Edward" instead? Some guests will give players the ability to pinpoint where he is hiding!


Various card effects:
Baron: All players take a random card from the hand of the player to their right.
Wizard: Trade your entire hand with another player.
Foreign Royal: Choose a card from your hand and trade it for the Princess.
Priest: You are exempt from all actions that affect a player's hand until your next turn.


—description by Raw Potions Publishing, publisher of the English localization

Name: Against the Shadow
Description:
Darkness falls upon the world of Urth, the Demon Lord’s shadow spreading chaos, war, and madness. The darker the shadow becomes, the worse the world gets until the Destroyer of Worlds finally emerges from the Void to devour and destroy everything. Are these the end times as foretold? 
Perhaps. Perhaps not.

Across the lands of Rûl, great patrons have come forth to answer the threat of the Eternal Shadow in a desperate bid to throw back the darkness and seal the rifts to the Demon Lord’s realm. The Great Druid rouses the forests to fight back against demon and cultist, while the Queen of the Fey rallies the last of her children to stand against the horrors loosed by the growing unrest. These and others come together to find the light that is needed to safeguard Urth for the rest of time.
     
     In this game, you play a patron, one of the great powers of Rûl, working to halt the demonic threat. You do this by recruiting heroes and sending them into deadly circumstances, to defeat demons and the vile cultists who summon them, to slay beasts, and to protect the failing light in the face of the encroaching shadow. 
     You win the game if the light reaches its goal before the shadow. You lose if the shadow reaches its goal before the light, or if four breach cards are in play.
     Against the Shadow is a cooperative game, best played with two to five players. A typical game takes about an hour to finish.

Name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: Order of the Phoenix Pack
Description: Includes Alastair Moody, Nymphadora Tonks, Kingsley Shacklebolt, Sirius Black, and Padfoot.

Name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: Unicorn Adventure Pack
Description: High quality resin miniatures, ready to paint and assemble. Includes character cards and spell cards for Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game. Contains a unicorn miniature and cooperative mode cards.

Name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: Remus Lupin & Werewolf Form
Description: Includes Remus Lupin and his Werewolf form.

Name: Harry Potter Miniatures Game: Rubeus Hagrid & Fang Expansion
Description:
Adds Rubeus Hagrid and Fang to Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game.

35mm Scale

Resin components.

Contents:
1 Rebeus Hagrid
1 Fang
2 Plastic Bases
2 Character Cards
1 Artifact Card

Name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: Malfoy Family Expansion
Description: Adds Lucius Malfoy, Narcissa Malfoy and Draco Malfoy to the game.

Name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: Bellatrix and Wormtail Expansion
Description: Adds Bellatrix Lestrange and Peter Pettigrew to the game.

Name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: Troll Adventure Pack Expansion
Description:
High quality resin miniature, ready to paint and assemble. Includes character cards and upgrade cards for the Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game.

Adds new scenario rules and a Troll miniature to the game.

Name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: Hogwarts Professors Expansion
Description:
Pack of high quality resin miniatures, ready to paint and assemble. Includes character cards and upgrade cards for the Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game.

Adds Gilderoy Lockhart, Minerva McGonagall, Severus Snape, and Dolores Umbridge to the game.

Name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: Ministry of Magic and Prophecy Room
Description: Adds three double-sided boards to the game for the Ministry of Magic and the Prophecy Room.

Name: Best of the Super Slime
Description:
Best of the Super Slime is a trick-taking game for 3 to 5 players.  Each player can play any card to a trick; there is no obligation to follow suit.  The highest card played in a non-lead suit will win the trick, with the tie going to the later card.  The winner collects all cards played to the trick.

The cards won go towards increasing the size of that player's "slime".  However, at the end of a hand, players will score points for the size of their slime (sum of the collected ranks) in relation to 100.  Points earned can be 0, 1, 2, 4 or 6.  For instance, if the sum of the player's cards won is larger than 100, the slime has collapsed and a player only receives 1 point.  If multiple players have a size less than 100, then the smallest of these is declared the Worst of the Small Slime and earns 0 points.

The game lasts 3 hands and the player with the highest cumulative points wins.

—user summary

Name: JoJo Siwa Bust A Bow Dance Game
Description:
"An exciting, rhythmic memory game!"

Players clip three bows into their hair. Each, on their turn, rolls two large dice which indicate a dance move to be done and a color on the mat on which to perform it. Each player performs all previous dance moves before adding their roll results to the routine. When a player makes a mistake they must remove one of their bows and the game resets. The last player to have a bow or bows remaining is the winner.

Name: Nobody, inside!
Description:
ä¸­ã®äººãªã‚“ã‹ã„ãªã„ï¼ (Nobody, inside!) is a mix of trick-taking and blind auction bidding, for 3-6 players. The deck shows visitors to a theme park, with the low cards also doubling as the costumed characters trying to get the visitors to ride on the attractions.

The game is played in alternating rounds of trick-taking and blind auctions. During the trick-taking, players follow normal trick-taking rules (follow the lead if possible, play a trump otherwise).

The winner of the round then leads a blind bidding, placing costumed cards face-down plus chips. Players that don't want to or cannot play a costumed mascot play a visitor instead, face-up as a discard. The winner of the auction collects visitors fom the other players, and sets the next trump colour.

At the end of the game, the players get points for the visitors they have earned, and a bonus for colour majorities.

The deck consists of cards 1-15 in 4 colors. Ranks 1-8 are "Visitor" cards, and ranks 9-15 may either be a "Visitor" card of rank 9-15 or rotated 180 degrees to be a "Costumed" card of rank 1-3. The game also comes with bidding chips which are distributed to the players.

The lead player has the option of starting a "Visitor" trick or a "Costumed" bid. A "Visitor" trick proceeds as a standard trick-taking game with players each playing a card from their hand (following suit if possible), and the winner being the player that played the highest ranked trump card, and if none were played, the highest ranked card in the lead suit.

In a "Costumed" bid, any player, including the lead player, that plays a "Costumed" card, plays it face down. Such players can also add up to 3 of their bidding chips to their card. Any player who does not want to or cannot play a "Costumed" card instead plays a "Visitor" card face up. At the end of the trick, the highest combined value of chips and "Costumed" card takes the trick, with the latter played breaking ties. The trump suit for "Visitor" rounds is determined by the last "Costumed" card color to win a "Costumed" trick.

The winner of the "Costumed" trick chooses between scoring all "Visitor" cards played to the trick that match the color of the winning costume or acquiring cards of this color from in front of the other players.

Players play a predetermined number of rounds, with the rules suggesting 3. Points are earned based upon the visitors scored during "Costumed" tricks and the number of colors of visitors obtained during "Visitor" tricks.

—user summary

Name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition) – Fury of the Storm
Description:
The Baratheons have held dominion over the Seven Kingdoms since Robert Baratheon seized the Iron Throne in open rebellion. This makes House Baratheon the most powerful House in Westeros, but it also means the Baratheons must constantly guard against the schemes of those who would threaten their throne. The threats come not only from other Houses, but also from within: as Renly Baratheon raises an army in the south, his brother Stannis turns to a new faith on Dragonstone. But if you can unite the brothers under your command, Westeros is sure to be yours!

Fury of the Storm is a deluxe expansion for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game that shines the spotlight on House Baratheon, the rulers of the Seven Kingdoms in the opening of George R. R. Martin’s A Song of Ice and Fire series. This expansion provides you with 156 cards, including new versions of powerful characters like brothers Robert, Stannis, and Renly Baratheon and cards that explore the King and R’hllor traits. But the Baratheons are the only ones to gain new tools. Every House in A Game of Thrones: The Card Game is represented here, gaining new House cards and a collection of neutral cards that any leader can use to their advantage.

Now, as Westeros threatens to fall into chaos, House Baratheon will come together bring their full force down upon those who would defy their rule. They will not surrender their power, and all who stand against them will see that theirs is the fury!

—description by the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: A Game of Thrones – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: Cultures of Man
Description:
A 2-5 player game about developing civilization and achieving objectives.

Players control a population at its infancy, growing and managing their population to achieve enough objectives to win the game. Each action a player takes will affect how that player’s population accumulates culture. Culture is a powerful tool that can give your population a competitive edge. Your population can take on aspects of Nomads, Seafarers, Merchants, and more, each enhancing your population through simple card play. Obtain enough culture cards and your population transforms mightily.

Players manage population tokens, gold, trade routes, and culture cards to achieve a set of public and private objectives that change with each game.  With a modular board that players build at the start of each game, a variety of objectives, and 9 different cultures, Cultures of Man delivers an epic experience for a family evening.

—description from the designer

Name: Raccoon Tycoon: The Fat Cat Expansion
Description:
The Fat Cat Expansion to Raccoon Tycoon adds new content that increases the number of players to six, adds new depth to the gameplay, fun new components and exciting new strategies.

The Fat Cat expansion adds two wild card railroads, new meeples that can be acquired for extra victory points, many more buildings that add extra strategies, player boards, and a new set of Railroad and town cards that allow a sixth player to be added.

—description from the publisher

Name: Whatever Happened to Pizza at McDonald's? (The Board Game)
Description:
Based on the award-worthy investigative journalism program (IJP), Whatever Happened to Pizza at McDonald's? (The Board Game)  simulates the battle between the Friends of Truth (those who would seek to uncover the true reason why McDonald's stopped serving pizza) and the Enemies of Truth (those who would keep this foul secret at all costs).

2-4 players will command their factions in a fierce competition that includes tactical movement around the dual-ringed board, risky management of resources, and clever card play using both "Tricks of the Trade" and "Undercover Ops".

Whatever Happened to Pizza at McDonald's? (The Board Game) combines the simple strategy of classic games with the diabolical intrigue of journalistic potboilers such as "All the President's Men".

Name: Bidders!
Description:
In Bidders!, a.k.a. ãƒ“ãƒƒãƒ€ãƒ¼ã‚º, the players are the leaders of craftsmen guilds and try to balance profits and support of the people.

The King has money, and bidding on his projects can be profitable, but your popular support will fall. The Prince is well supported, but has a limited budget.

At the end of the game, the player with the lowest support is ineligible to win, and the player with the most money of the remaining players will win.

—user summary

Name: Korpoludki
Description:
Board game designed for 2-5 players aged from 12 years.

Rat race in the Corporation - it's not a catch. To climb the top of the KORPO S.A. in Mordor, get as many prestige points as possible. To this end, players collect First, Second, Third and Top Degree Attribute Cards. The one who scores the most points wins.

Players traverse a board (a corporate skyscraper) using action cards and visit various rooms and offices which enable them to collect attribute cards (representing various objects). Specific sets of these cards can be exchanged for a stronger attribute card of a highers level which usually give winning points and sometimes additional bonuses.

—description from the publisher

Name: Splendor: Diane de Poitiers Promo Noble
Description:
Promotional noble offered by the publisher.

Requires 3 black and 3 green and 3 blue to claim this noble for 3 points.

Works like any other noble and is just mixed into any game of Splendor that includes nobles. Cannot be used with the "Cities of Splendor" module in Cities of Splendor expansion.

Name: Guilds of London: Wards of London
Description:
London is a city divided. Guilds and politics separate the people, while physical areas within the city are also segregated by invisible lines.

Vetos, coins, new plantations, new rewards, triple-coloured Guilds and businesses, legal bodies and famous landmarks bring new intrigue to medieval London.

The Wards of London provide new opportunities for new machinations, a new map of the city (way of playing) as well as enough components to allow a 5th player to participate.

—description from the publisher

Name: 1.SS-Panzerdivison Leibstandarte  Normandie
Description:
This is a set of eight scenarios for Advanced Squad Leader. The scenarios all include German units from the 1st SS Panzerdivision Leibstandarte Division Normandie

These scenarios tend to be a mix of medium and large numbers of troops. Here is a summary of each scenario as provided by Lone Canuck Publishing:

     LSSAH 41 - Mouen, France, 28 June 1944: British spearheads of the 15th Scottish Division have advanced south, seizing bridges over the Orne River. The 1.SS-Panzerdivision Leibstandarte is ordered to launch an immediately counterattack to cut-off the penetration before the British can get a foothold. Map Boards: 2, Turns: 8
     LSSAH 42 - Hubert-Folie, France, 18 July 1944: The British launch Operation GOODWOOD in the hopes to break into open tank country, southeast of Caen. The 1.SS-Panzerdivision Leibstandarte is rushed into a blocking position unseen by Allied observers and waits in ambush, directly in the path of the 3rd Battalion, Royal Tank Regiment.Map Boards: 2, Overlays: 3, Turns: 7
     LSSAH 43 - Solders, France, 18 July 1944: Despite heavy losses, Operation GOODWOOD continued to grind its way forward, the battlefield littered with burning hulls of the British 11th Armoured Division. Shortly after midday, the 2/Fife and Forfar Yeomanry is ordered to capture the Bourgébus Ridge; simultaneously, the 1.SS-Panzerdivision Leibstandarte is ordered to counterattack. Map Boards: 3, Overlays: 1, Turns: 7½
     LSSAH 44 - Tilly-la-Campagne, France, 25 July 1944: The Americans had launched Operation COBRA, at the same the Canadians had launched Operation SPRING; its objective to capture Point 122. On route the Canadians had to first clear Tilly-la-Campagne, where hidden among the smoulder ruins were the Pioniers, Panzergrenadiers, and Panzers the 1.SS-Panzerdivision Leibstandarte. Map Boards: 2, Turns: 7
     LSSAH 45 - Saint Barthelemy, France, 7 August 1944: The Germans launched Operation LÜTTICH, its objective to recapture Avranches and cut-off Patton's 3rd Army spilling into Brittiany. In the foggy morning hours, 1.SS-Panzerdivision Leibstandarte drove into Saint Barthelemy fully expecting the village to be cleared earlier by 2.Panzerdivision; but as the fog lifted, the lead elements found themselves fighting in close quarters with GIs of the 117th Infantry Regiment. Map Boards: 4, Overlays: 1, Turns: 7½ 
     LSSAH 46 - Saint Barthelemy, France, 9 August 1944: The 1.SS-Panzerdivision Leibstandarte attack ground to a halt. Overhead Allied Fighter-Bombers circled waiting to pounce. The US 117th Regiment, having received reinforcements that morning, launched a counterattack looking to retake ground earlier given up. Map Boards: 4, Turns: 7½
     LSSAH 47 - Joue-du-Bois, France, 13 August 1944: Field Marshal Montgomery ordered the gap  between Falaise and Alençon shut, hoping to trap a large portion of the German 7th Army within it. The 1.SS-Panzerdivision Leibstandarte received orders to hold open the narrowing corridor to allow the what was left of the 7th Army to withdraw out of the collapsing pocket. Map Boards: 4, Turns: 7½
     LSSAH 48 - Saint-Lambert, France, 20 August 1944: The Allies' noose was tightening about the neck of the Falaise Pocket. The 1.SS-Panzerdivision Leibstandarte reduced to little more than a pair kampfgruppes was tasked to lead the breakout out of the pocket. Map Boards: 2, Turns: 6½
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Run Fight or Die: Reloaded – 5-6 Player Expansion
Description: Increases the player count to 5-6 players. It includes 2 character boards, 2 zombie boards and 30 additional zombie miniatures.

Name: kiSabadulos: Toys are going into the world
Description:
DIY KIDS sold by HOMESCAPE is a series of escape room style educative puzzle games specifically for kindergarten and pre-school age children.

The second in the series is: "Toys are going into the world" where the plush toys of a little girl, fed up with being left on the floor night after night, decide to leave. The group of players has to help the protagonists navigate through their journey and discover in the end that all has happened in the girl's head while dreaming (but of course she will never again leave her room untidy before going to bed).

Children in groups of 1-4 (aided by an adult game master) solve a total of 11 varied puzzles to advance the story and achieve the final goal. The quest is expected to be completed in 75 minutes, and the team scores points for extra time left as well as puzzles solved without hints. The game comes with a game master guide to set up and play through the adventure.

Name: Vindication: Community Promo Pack
Description:
The community designed Promo Pack was made for the Kickstarter of the first expansion Vindication: Leaders & Alliances. This pack contains new cards for the base game that were created by the community during the 2019 Kickstarter.

This pack includes:
Companion - Rho, the Illuminated
Companion - Tensho of the Warded Way
Companion - Bracca, The Tactical
Companion - Vetra, Shadowstepper
Relic - Dreams of Daedalus
Monster - Grewl, of the Muck
Monster - The Lurking Herd
Trait - Grit
Trait - Benevolence
Pet - Agios, the Wandering Guardian
Pet - Neeko the Playful
Pet - Aria, the Winged Chime

Name: Monopoly: Animaccord Edition
Description:
It’s been 10 years since the Animaccord team started the production of the Marsha and the Bear cartoon. The series, which today, without any overstatement, has been a worldwide YouTube phenomenon that has conquered the hearts of billions of kids and their parents throughout the world.
This special board game is created and issued to mark the 10th anniversary of Animaccord Studio’s establishment.  Step by step, you will pass through all stages of production of an animated series – starting with script writing all the way to the first episode releasing on air.  Will you be able to sell the brand’s licensing for the creation of consumer products?  Are you ready to be at the top of your industry and get international success?
The game vividly shows all the obstacles that the Animaccord studio has handled over the last 10 years.  Just like in real life, you will face the design, technical, and financial issues, as well as the legal specifics of business management – simply everything behind the scenes of the tremendously popular cartoon.
Feels like a challenge?  Of course!  But, we believe that you will accomplish this mission and find success with your beloved heroes.  Marsha and the Bear despite all obstacles you will face on your path.  The Animaccord team has done it, so can you!
We wish you good luck!

—description from the back of the box

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Name: Hellboy: The Board Game – The Wild Hunt
Description:
Hellboy: The Board Game – The Wild Hunt adds gameplay elements from the "The Wild Hunt" storyline in the Hellboy comic series to Hellboy: The Board Game.

This expansion consists of:

1 hero miniature (Enraged Hellboy)
1 backup agent miniature (Alice)
1 agent card (Enraged Hellboy)
1 Alice backup agent card
5 enemy cards
40 case file cards (6+9+10+15)
7 requisition / starting cards
19 deck of doom cards
13 encounter cards
4 boss behaviour cards
7 scenery / furniture tokens
7 double sided game tiles
1 boss (Eligos)
12 enemie minis (4+4+2+2)
1 key token
4 tokens

Name: Hunt for the Big Five
Description:
Find and shoot Africa’s “Big Five” animals (with your camera) on a three-day African safari to earn victory points (VPs). The player with the most VPs at the end of the game wins. Watch out, though -- because an animal can charge and wound you if you get too close! A few special cards can spice things up, too.

Both players secretly “bid” on which of two areas they want to visit. To do this, they choose one or two Animal cards with coins to influence their safari guide.

The card(s) are then revealed and the player with the higher total of coins chooses where the hunt will take place; i.e., which area will be visited. This player then plays another Animal card from his hand, which must match the chosen terrain, and rolls the die. If it falls within the range (1, 1-2 or 1-3) on the card then his shot is successful and he retains this card and its VPs, visible to both players.

Play continues over three decks, and a winner is determined. A 3-point bonus goes to a player if he shoots all of the Big Five.

—description from the designer

Name: Sovereign: Solve, Conquer, Expand
Description:
Sovereign is a game similar to Risk, Settlers of Catan, and Monopoly, if all were rolled into one game.

Players will manage their TEMPER Attributes in order to remain in power. TEMPER stands for Trustworthiness, Economics, Military, Population, Environment, and Resources. Each of these Attributes are needed to maintain a healthy nation and a healthy ruler.

Players will spend 1/2 of each Round in a specific phase, played at the same time. Event Phases are set up as follows:

     Players draw event cards.
     Players solve event cards in one minute.
     Players vote on other player's solutions.


The second phase is the Action Phase, where players expand by buying tiles or trading for them, build Resource collectors, or make armies. There's a lot you can do during this phase.

Players will play until either all are eliminated or one Sovereign remains.

—description from the designer

Name: Alchemental: Rise of the Celestial Sphere
Description:
A 2-4 player epic fantasy deck building game set in the Celestial Sphere universe.

Objective: to forge the philosopher's stone before your opponents do.

Game-Play: use Elementals to defeat your opponent(s)' typhonn, gain and mine Alchemics to forge shards. Once eight shards are made, you can forge the Philosopher's stone and WIN.

This game is rooted in alchemy and offers a truly unique gaming experience by introducing new species and lore outside of traditional fantasy tropes.

—description from the designer

Name: My Rotten World
Description:
An adult party card game that celebrates the rotten world. It's funny, totally different and politically INcorrect.

My Rotten World is an adult party game where you steal, dump, peek, barf cards to win the ultimate title of the Rotten Dragon. Our humorous illustrations bring the cards to life.
To win, you must get rid of all of your cards, while holding on to the Rotten card. This proves you are the most rotten of them all!

Setup
This game is for 2-4 players, ages "18" and over. 
Every player is dealt with five cards. The rest of the deck is placed face down. Keep space next to the deck for the discard pile.

How do you play?
The most rotten person starts the game and the gameplay follows a clockwise direction.           
For your turn, you can play any card in your hand by putting it in the discard pile. You take the action that is on the card. If you don't have a card that you want to play, then you draw from the deck as your turn.

When you start the game, the rotten card can only be one of 3 places. In your hand, in someone else’s hand or in the deck. During your turn, you will play a card in your hand and do that action. So if you think that one of your friends has "the rotten card"? You can “steal” a card or “swap hands”. If you think that the card is in the deck? You can play “Grab Four, you whore!” and take 4 from the deck in hopes of pulling the rotten card. 
What if you have the rotten card? It’s time to try to get rid of all of the other cards.
Maybe play a “dump” card and give your shit to someone else. Oh and remember, if you have the rotten card, it’s best to keep a poker face

How do you win?
You WIN when the only card you have left is the ROTTEN card.

To get the ROTTEN card: you will steal cards, draw cards, swap cards, grab cards, dump cards, burn cards and do whatever it takes to get….and keep the ROTTEN card.

—description from the publisher

Name: KSAR
Description:
The game contents 24 coloured pieces (12 of each colour) and 6 uncoloured pieces (parallelepipeds “1 x 2 x 3”) and 4 borders to make the frame for the game.
Each player takes the pieces of one colour and 3 uncoloured pieces.
The aim of the Game is to connect the longest series of pieces of your colour. 
Uncoloured pieces count as either colour.
The players take turns to place one of their pieces in the frame. It can be placed flat, on its side or vertically. 
Each piece placed must be against another piece and / or an edge and must not be placed against a piece of the same height.
The game ends when one of the players can't play any more.
The players count their longest series of pieces, including uncoloured ones. They must deduct one point for any unplayed uncoloured pieces.
The winner is the one with the highest score.

—description from the designer

Name: Solo Assistant: Nations at War / World at War 85
Description:
One Solo Assistant for Two-Game Systems

The Solo Assistant is a solo game assistant designed for Nations At War.  We have expanded the Solo Assistant so you can also use it with World At War 85 game series.  Allowing you to use the Solo Assistant for both game series.  This Solo Assistant will allow players to take most scenarios from any Nations At War series, Battle Generators, or World At War 85 series and play them solo.  Where the choices for the player’s opponent are made by the solo game assistant system.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Nations at War (Lock 'n Load Publishing)
Series: World At War 85 (Lock 'n Load Publishing)

Name: Battle For Abbaye Des Ardenne: The First Step to Caen
Description:
The Battle for the Abbaye des Ardennes is a small scenario pack created by the Lone Canuck Publishing, but never offered for sale.  This scenario pack was made available to ASL tournament directors to be given out as prizes.
  
These scenarios are a mix of large and very large numbers of troops. Here is a summary of the seven scenarios:


     #1 The Contest For St. Contest. Operation Charmwood opened up on 8 July 1944 for the 1/7th Royal Warwickshire Regiment whos objective was the Norman Village of St. Contest. Waiting for them was III/SS-Panzergrenadier Regiment 25. 3 boards, one overlay and 10 turns.



     #2 First Big Fight. Buron France 8 July 1944. The 3rd British Division has captured Lebisey, but the British 59th Division was still struggling with its initial objectives. Once more Buron would be attacked with St. Contest in the hands of the German's 12th SS-Hitlerjugend Division. 3 boards, one overlay and 10 turns.



     #3 Crazy Carriers. Gruchy France 8 July 1944. The Stormont, Dundas, Glengarry Highlanders, and Sherbrooke Fusilirs began their attack protected by a hail of shells that threw up great clouds of dust. Under the heavy shelling the Germans were forced to crouch in the bottom of their trenches. When the artillery lifted, the Germans came to life and brought their machine guns to bear on the advancing Highlanders. 4 boards and 9 turns.



     #4 Able Forward.  Authie France 8 July 1944. The North Nova Scotia Highlanders planned to push south and capture Authie and then Franqueville while the Glengarries would take the old chateau about a half mile from Authie. As they advanced German mortar and 88 fire tore into the infantry companies. Under this  relentless fire from the German SS, the order "Able Forward" was given. Three boards and 10 turns.



     #5 No Taste for Cold Steel. 8 July 1944. The Canadians attempt to pry fanatical Hitler Youth from Cussy and the Abbey. Two Boards and 7 turns.



     #6 Storming the Abbey. 8 July 1944. Cussy France. The Regina Rifles reach and attack the Abbey des Ardennes, the command post of SS Panzergrenadier Regiment 25.  Two boards, 7 overlays and 9 turns.



     #7 Tip of the Spear.  Upon entering the small village of Buron, The advance party of the Fusiliers come into contact with hidden German machineguns and anti-tank guns, determined to stop the Canadian advance. Three boards and 10 turns.

Name: Face the Consequences
Description: FTC is a universal add-on to any game that adds a loss mechanic. Simply choose a loser every round, by picking the worst card, the slowest player, someone who broke a house rule, etc., and they need to perform an action for being the worst. There are no firm rules for how to implement FTC, so be creative and let the group decide! The Core Deck is suitable for ALL ages, and the NSFT (Not Safe for Wimps) is for 21+

Name: カラーギャングルズ (Color Gangsters)
Description:
ã‚«ãƒ©ãƒ¼ã‚®ãƒ£ãƒ³ã‚°ãƒ«ã‚º (Color Gangsters) is a trick-taking game in which players attempt to meet certain conditions while playing through their hand of cards.

To set up the game, shuffle the sixteen tiles, then lay out nine of them at random in a 3x3 grid. Each tile has a different condition on it that a player must meet in order to claim the tile. Players each receive a hand of nine cards from a fifty-card deck, with the deck having five suits of cards, each numbered 1-10. These cards show the color of the suit on their back, revealing that information to all players.

The game includes six color trump cards (one for each color and one for no color) and eleven number trump cards.

As players complete tricks, if they meet the condition on a tile, they mark it with one of their markers. If a player places three of their markers in a line, they win the game.

Name: da Vinci Castle
Description:
This is a family game to test your memory. Can you find the secret code hidden in the castle?

In da Vinci Castle, you play the game on the assumption that Leonardo da Vinci has built six castles. He has a  hidden a different secret code  in each castle, and if you decrypt it, you can destroy it. Maybe it's a genius' eccentricity to hide these deadly weaknesses in the castle that he built.

Each player receives a piece with a color and a piece with a number, creating a castle with a secret password. And when it's your turn, you either ask questions or attack.

You can ask questions only to the player on your left. Choose a color and a number and say, "Do you have red or four?" If the player who was asked has either, they say yes, if they have neither, then the player goes on to say no. Ask questions to get a clue to what the other player's secret password is.

Once you are sure what the other player's secret password is, you can attack your opponent and destroy their castle. However, if you attack your opponent's castle with the wrong secret code, you must be careful because your castle will collapse and you will be eliminated from the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Azarashi Attack
Description:
Become an AZARASHI (seal) and fetch your yummy food!
All you need to do is just slide on the ice!
If you wish, you can attack other AZARASHI and rob their food too!

Players move their AZARASHI tokens on a field made of multiple hexagonal tiles and aim to get more foods. Players can rob a food from rivals too. 
You can get a food when you stop on target tile. You can charge “Attack Power” when you stop in your zone.

Player chooses an action up to three times in his turn and acts. You can do any combination of the following three actions.

     Keep on moving stright until you hit a rival or ice token.
     Generate the ice token on the field.
     Attack rivals or ice token. (It is necessary to charge the “Attack Power” in advance)


ã€€You can take his food from him by dropping rival to the sea.

It is a strategic game that aims to get a lot of food by using the ice tokens and the arrangement of rivals.

—description from the publisher

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Deeproot Strongbranch – Star Player
Description:
A classic Star Player is reborn, or rather he's so ancient he just grew a bit larger and more imposing. He's one of the largest Big Guys available to any team, and the fact he stands with Halflings only makes him more impressive. Though his services don't come cheap for an up-and-coming team, if you want to win with the Greenfield Grasshuggers you'll find his strength and toughness too tempting to pass up.

This finely-detailed resin model is supplied in 25 components, including a 40mm round base. You'll enjoy looking for tiny details tucked away in various nooks and crannies, hinting at both his venerable history, and the forests he calls home. Deeproot Strongbranch is only available to play for Halfling teams. You can find all the rules you need to use him in your games of Blood Bowl in the 5th issue of Spike! Journal.

(from publisher)

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Lord Borak the Despoiler – Star Player
Description:
Lord Borak the Despoiler is one of Blood Bowl’s most popular Star Players – and not just for his bone-crunching skills on the pitch. After all, he’s been Spike! Journal’s favourite agony uncle for longer than anyone can remember, always willing to offer his ultra-violent advice in his regular column, 'Ask Lord Borak'. However, this Hall of Famer forged his legend on the gridiron, cracking skulls and tearing off limbs with nothing more that brute strength and a hyper-belligerent attitude.

Lord Borak is an excellent all-rounder on the pitch, with a Strength to rival Big Guys and an Agility that means even ball-handling isn't out of the question. The miniature sees Borak giving a thumbs up to his adoring fans. Around his neck is his lucky set of talismans, displaying the symbols of the four Dark Gods and a Chaos Star.

Lord Borak the Despoiler is a 10-part resin miniature and is supplied with a 32mm Blood Bowl Round Base and a resin Blood Bowl token, with Lord Borak's icon on one side.

Coaches of Chaos Chosen and Nurgle teams can recruit Lord Borak the Despoiler using the rules found in the Blood Bowl Almanac 2018.

Key Features:

     One of Blood Bowl’s most (in)famous Star Players
     Can be included in Chaos Chosen and Nurgle teams
     A strong but well-rounded player


—description from the publisher

Name: Template of War
Description:
Temple of War is a heavy wargame using an innovative combat and skirmish system. The game will come with several full-fledged campaigns and can be played from 1 to 10 players (or more). The campaign is built in such a way that the players can play different stages at the same table or individually at home, and update the state of the game/world based on their progress. It's possible to drop out or jump into any game at any time, as each player controls their own army/faction. The game can adapt to any situation on the fly, without the need to restart or wait for each other. The game will come with an app, so you will be able to engage in a campaign with anyone around the world.

The theme of the game is based on a never before used (in boardgames) high-fantasy IP that will be revealed later next year.

—description from the designer

Name: Mar Rojo
Description:
The Spanish Civil War at Sea
In summer of 1936 the Spanish Navy was the eighth world naval power, with 2 battleships, 4 cruisers, 15 destroyers and 12 submarines. Following the nation's fate, the Navy was also split in two. War at sea was mostly long and hard convoy warfare blockade, counter-blockade and a few naval surface actions (like the sinking of the Baleares heavy cruiser). Anyway, much like on land, both sides fought with equal valor at sea.

"Mar Rojo" (Red Sea, the name of a merchant ship that was part of both navies) is an exciting, fast-paced card battle wargame for one or two players about the Spanish Civil War at sea.

Each player begins with five cards in hand and a fleet of 5-12 ships. The object of the game is try to sink the enemy warships while your own merchant ships arrive at secure harbour.

—description from the designer

Name: Bloodborne: The Board Game – Hunter's Dream
Description:
The streets of Yharnam are being flooded with monsters. The Hunters already had their work cut out for them, but now more brutal foes have taken to the dark alleyways. What was once a dangerous situation has turned truly nightmarish. Will the Hunters make it to dawn?

The Hunter's Dream expansion for Bloodborne: The Board Game gives players new challenges and rewards that can be added to any campaign they choose to play. This set introduces mini bosses, tougher foes that players will have to fight as they go through the campaign. It also adds a new chapter to the end. Just when the Hunters thought that their ordeal was over, new foes stand in their way, including legendary enemies like Gehrman, the First Hunter, and the Moon Presence.

—description from the publisher

Name: Master Spy!
Description:
Four master spies seek to gather information for their respective governments and return to their headquarters. This is a pure roll-and-move game. Player order is determined by an initial die roll, and all movement is determined by die rolls. The track is 65 spaces long and includes obstacles like "Lose 1 Turn" and "Roll 2 to Leave." If, during the game, a player lands on an occupied space, that player must return all the way to the start space.

Some spaces on the board require players to draw a "Confidential Card." These include such directions as "Return to the Warehouse. Confirm report that premises are now being used by a Foreign Government, as a base for operations. (Lose two turns.)" and "Conditions now favorable in your sector. Roll die two times. Add up the total and move ahead."

The winner is the first player to reach the finish space.

—user summary

Name: Fat Cats
Description:
In this ancient game of strategy, each player seeks to immobilize and remove all their opponent's pieces. Although an easy game to lean a high level of tactical skill is needed to win. (Source: Game Box)

In detail it is played like this. Each player selects a set of 5 pieces in their color and both players place those pieces on the outer lines on opposing sites. Now players take turns and during their turn, they can move one of their pieces one space from one corner of a square to another. If a player manages to trap an opponents piece the trapped piece is removed from the board. The player eliminating all pieces of the opponent wins the game.

Name: そのリスク、ヘッジしていこう！ (Sono Risuku, Hejji Shiteikou)
Description:
In ãã®ãƒªã‚¹ã‚¯ã€ãƒ˜ãƒƒã‚¸ã—ã¦ã„ã“ã†ï¼ (Sono Risuku, Hejji Shiteikou), which roughly translates as "The risk, let's hedge!", the players are risk managers on projects at work and aim to keep them from exploding from too much risk.

The cards in the game are ranked 1-8 in 4 suits.  On their turn, a player draws a risk card from the deck and places it into a 3x3 area in front of them.  If a player's area is full, their project has failed.  However, certain criteria will allow the risks to be mitigated, such as adjacent pairs of numbers or straight flushes. There is some interaction between the players' risk areas.

If the game ends due to a player's project failing, all other players win.  If the deck of cards is exhausted, the player with the highest total risk at the time loses.

—user summary

Name: The Boys Combat Card Game
Description:
Straight from the pages of The Boys comics, players take the role of The Boys.  In a world where costumed heroes soar through the sky and masked vigilantes prowl the night, someone's got to make sure the "supes" don't get out of line. And someone will! Billy Butcher, Wee Hughie, Mother's Milk, The Frenchman, and The Female are The Boys: A CIA-backed team of very dangerous people, each one dedicated to the struggle against the most dangerous force on Earth - superpower! Some superheroes have to be watched. Some have to be controlled. And some of them - sometimes - need to be taken out of the picture. That's when you call in The Boys!

This cooperative game allows the players to take the role of The Boys.  Players will play allies, actions, and moves against the various Supers that come up, trying to take them out with straight brawn, or finding devious ways to take them out with things like blackmail!   Protecting the public can be a dirty job, and... that's what The Boys do!

Superheroes are drawn each round, and must be dealt with, or they will cause collateral damage.  If they cause too much damage, the players lose!

Can you help to protect the public from out-of-control super-powered "heroes"?

—description from the publisher

Name: Void Scepter: Solo Campaign
Description:
Void Scepter is a single player campaign for Imperium: The Contention. In this campaign, your choices will determine what you encounter as you pursue the Void Scepter - given to those who become emperor of the Imperium. But beware, for your pursuit of the Void Scepter may result in your worlds burning, your empire crumbling, and your untimely death. Your decisions will guide you from one potentially deadly scenario to another. You may tackle threats not just to your empire, but possibly the entire Imperium.

Each scenario has its own setup. You’ll be controlling an “Enemy” that will take actions described in the scenario.

—description from the rulebook

Name: Cthulhu Wars: Investigators
Description: Neutral investigator miniatures with loyalty cards to add to Cthulhu Wars. These human Investigators add an extra dimension of game play by being enemies to all players, even though they are purchased by one, and handicapping any player they are attached to. They represent humanity's last ditch effort in a post-apocalyptic battle to thwart the Great Old Ones' struggle for dominance over the earth.
